meanings.definition: Wind blowing in the opposite direction to the one in which one is moving.
meanings.sent1: The sailor felt the strong backwind pushing against the sails.
meanings.sent2: The backwind made it difficult for the boat to move forward.
meanings.sent3: The backwind played a trick on the sailor, making the journey longer than expected.
meanings.sent4: The backwind whispered secrets as it swirled around the ship.
meanings.sent5: The backwind howled fiercely, creating waves of resistance.

meanings.definition: To be blown in the opposite direction to the one in which one is moving.
meanings.sent1: She tried to walk forward, but the strong backwind kept pushing her back.
meanings.sent2: The kite backwinded suddenly, surprising the kids playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous backwind teased the runner by making him run in place.
meanings.sent4: His words backwinded, leaving him speechless in front of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The backwind of change swept through the town, altering everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To provide wind power to a sail from the opposite direction to the one in which the vessel is moving.
meanings.sent1: The skilled sailor backwinded the sail to catch the opposing breeze.
meanings.sent2: Backwinding the sail helped the boat pick up speed in the regatta.
meanings.sent3: The playful backwind danced with the sail, giving the boat an extra boost.
meanings.sent4: The backwinding wind filled the sail like a gentle hand guiding the vessel.
meanings.sent5: Backwinding at the right moment propelled the boat forward with ease.
